text: The difficult part is that Q is non local: I have a threshold in the h field. When a point gets below the threshold, I force all the points within a given radius of said point with an increase in h, this has also a finite duration.

elements.text: The difficult part is that Q is non local: I have a threshold in the h field. When a point gets below the threshold, I force all the points within a given radius of said point with an increase in h, this has also a finite duration.

text: I would like to know how feasible does it sound to implement such a forcing in Oceananigans. I have an implementation in dedalus (python/c) but it is infinitely slow possibily because of my bad python+numba skills, and I’ve been wanting to take oceananigans for a spin

text: There is a shallow water model that you can use but it is hard to say how easy it is for you to use without knowing the particular form for the forcing.  Could you give more details how you set Q in your working code?
